chapter.title: Cataloging Maintenance Documents
chapter.para: Bibliographic and Instance attribute maintenance e-docs are available via the Cataloging submenu on the Rice 2 menu tab.

section.title: Bibliographic Record Status

para.emphasis:
> Bibliographic Record Status
> Bibliographic Record Status Lookup
> Bibliographic Record Status

section.para: The Bibliographic Record Status maintenance document is used to assign a status to a bibliographic record. Some examples include cataloging complete, on order, electronic resource.
Only system administrators will be able to create and add Bibliographic Record Statuses.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Bibliographic Record Status document includes the Add/Edit Bibliographic Record Status tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit Bibliographic Record Status tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify the bibliographic record status. Maximum length is 30 characters.
Required. The familiar title of the bibliographic record status. Maximum length is 100 characters.
Required. The source of the bibliographic record status.
Required. The date for which the bibliographic record status was retrieved from the source.
Indicates whether the bibliographic record status is active or inactive. Remove the checkmark to deactivate this code

section.title: Globally Protected Field

para.emphasis:
> Bib Overlay Protected Field
> Globally Protected Field Lookup
> Globally Protected Field

section.para: The Globally Protected Field Maintenance Document is used to maintain the protected fields for importing files into the OLE DocStore. The globally protected fields contain MARC tags/indicators/subfields that should not be dropped from the MARC record but could be modified if indicated.

A list entry has several data elements: tag, first indicator, second indicator, (optionally) subfield code, and protection flag. Wildcards (for example: 01*, 9**, 050*) can be used anywhere except for the protection flag. The list entry will apply to all matching fields.

note.para: Globally protected fields can be overridden through the load profile.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Globally Protected Field document includes the Add/Edit Globally Protected Field tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit Globally Protected Field tab definition

entry.para: Required. The MARC tag that will globally protected during ingest.
Optional. The MARC first indicator that will be globally protected during ingest.
Optional. The MARC second indicator that will be globally protected during ingest.
Optional. The MARC subfield that will be globally protected during ingest.
Indicates whether this licensing requirement code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Bib Import Preferences

para.emphasis:
> Bib Import Preference
> Import Bib User Preferences Lookup
> Import Bib User Preferences

section.para: Users may set preferences to apply to all records during the import process. These settings can be overridden during the import process.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The User Preferences document includes the Add/Edit Import Bib User Preference tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit Import Bib User Preference tab definition

entry.para: The familiar title of the user preference.
Select the type of import to be performed from the dropdown list.
Select a status for the bibliographic records to inherit upon import completion.
Optional. Select a temporary location for the bibliographic records to inherit upon import completion.
Select a permanent location for the bibliographic records to inherit upon import completion.
Enter any tags to be removed when importing bibliographic records
Enter any tags that will not be affected when importing bibliographic records
Select the classification scheme for the bibliographic records to inherit upon import completion.
Enter a first priority for mapping MARC fields and subfields into OLE item’s call number fields.
Enter a second priority for mapping MARC fields and subfields into OLE item’s call number fields.
Enter a third priority for mapping MARC fields and subfields into OLE item’s call number fields.

section.title: Call Number Type

para.emphasis:
> Call Number Type
> Call Number Type Lookup
> Call Number Type

section.para: The Call Number Type maintenance document defines what type of classification system is used within OLE. Call Number Types are used on Holdings, Items, and E-Holdings records and can be searched upon from the Search Workbench. Some examples include Library of Congress, Dewey Decimal.

When a call number is assigned to a holdings or an item, whether by a cataloger or by a batch load process, the call number type has to be specified. The call number type determines how OLE assigns the Shelving Order value, which is used for sorting call numbers when you do a call number browse in Search Workbench. If you enter “DC223.4 .C83 2014” in the Call Number field of a holdings record, choose “Library of Congress Classification,” and submit, OLE automatically formulates a Shelving Order value of “DC 0223.400000 C0.830000 002014” for sorting purposes.

Because call number type is associated with the process of formulating Shelving Order values, you are not able make up a new call number type from within the Call Number Type document without modifying the code and formulating rules for Shelving Order values.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Call Number Type document includes the Add/Edit Call Number Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit Call Number Type tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify the call number type. Maximum length is 30 characters.
Required. The familiar title of the call number type. Maximum length is 100 characters.
Required. The hyperlink to the source of the call number type.
Required. The date for which the call number type was retrieved from the source.
Indicates whether the call number type is active or inactive. Remove the checkmark to deactivate this code

section.title: Extent of Ownership Type (Type of Ownership)

para.emphasis:
> Extent of Ownership Type
> Extent of Ownership Type Lookup
> Extent of Ownership Type

section.para: The Type of Ownership maintenance document describes the type of information to be captured for the extent of ownership. Some examples include basic, supplementary, and indexes.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Type of Ownership document includes the Add/Edit Type of Ownership tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit Type of Ownership tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify the extent of ownership. Maximum length is 100 characters.
Required. The familiar title of the extent of ownership. Maximum length is 100 characters.
Required. The hyperlink to the source of the extent of ownership.
Required. The date for which the extent of ownership was retrieved from the source.
Indicates whether the extent of ownership is active or inactive. Remove the checkmark to deactivate this code

section.title: Item Availability Status

para.emphasis:
> Item Availability Status
> Item Availability Status Lookup
> Item Availability Status

section.para: The Item Availability Status maintenance document defines the status of an item. Some examples include on order, available, loaned and intransit.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Item Availability Status document includes the Add/Edit Item Availability Status tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit Item Availability Status tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify the item availability status. Maximum length is 30 characters.
Required. The familiar title of the item availability status. Maximum length is 100 characters.
Indicates whether the item availability status is active or inactive. Remove the checkmark to deactivate this code

section.title: Item Type

para.emphasis:
> Item Type
> Item Type Lookup
> Item Type

section.para: The Item Type maintenance document defines library items types. Some examples include DVD, 2-hour reserve, 24 hour loan. The Item Type is used to determine loan periods for circulating library materials.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Item Type document includes the Add/Edit Item Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

entry.para: The code to identify the Instance item type. Maximum length is 30 characters.
Required. The familiar title of the Instance item type. Maximum length is 100 characters.
The familiar description of the Instance item type
Required. The source of the Instance item type.
Required. The date for which the Instance item type was retrieved from the source.
Indicates whether the Instance item type is active or inactive. Remove the checkmark to deactivate this code

section.title: Receipt Status

para.emphasis:
> Receipt Status
> Receipt Status Lookup
> Receipt Status

section.para: The Receipt Status maintenance document describe the status of newly published parts of a mulitpart or serial item.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Receipt Status document includes the Add/Edit Receipt Status tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

entry.para: The code to identify the receipt status. Maximum length is 30 characters.
Required. The familiar title of the receipt status. Maximum length is 100 characters.
Required. The hyperlink to the source of the receipt status.
Required. The date for which the receipt status was retrieved from the source.
Indicates whether the receipt status is active or inactive. Remove the checkmark to deactivate this code

section.title: Statistical Searching Codes

para.emphasis:
> Statistical Searching Codes
> Statistical Searching Codes Lookup
> Statistical Searching Codes Maintenance

section.para: The Statistical Searching Code maintenance document defines items. It is used to help limit items when searching and used for reporting. Some examples include Juvenile, CD, Microfiche and GovDocs.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Statistical Searching Codes document includes the Add/Edit Statistical Searching Codes tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit Statistical Searching Codes tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify the statistical searching code. Maximum length is 30 characters.
Required. The familiar title of the statistical searching code. Maximum length is 30 characters.
Required. The hyperlink to the source of the statistical searching code.
Required. The date for which the statistical searching code was retrieved from the source.
Indicates whether the statistical searching code is active or inactive. Remove the checkmark to deactivate this code
